website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you need a multi-position hand truck that can accommodate more than a few hundred pounds, but it may not hold up to its rated 700-pound capacity.
pros: Not too heavy, as it features the brand's glass-filled nylon truss
Has a convenient telescopic handle and 10-inch front tires
Mid-level hauling capacity for a decent price
cons: During assembly, some owners found that pieces and hardware didn't line up
700-pound capacity is questionable, as components have been known to break while hauling less weight

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, and lightweight But...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 700# capacity model. I’ve used it lightly around the house and was very happy with the wheels and lightness and maneuverability. We needed to move a 150# treadmill up a ramp out of a basement. Strong fellow pushing two above pulling and the unit snapped in two one both arms on one side, one arm on the other. We managed to reach down to the remaining half and complete the project. I reported to Harper and despite a fast response from customer service , have not been offered any solutions. Likely just a random flaw in the casting.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W

customer_reviews.title: Works well. A little bulky. But I've had ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. A little bulky. But I've had alot of weight on it and it functioned well. Even though it's made of plastic it is still very strong. It is thick heavy duty plastic. An aluminum hand truck of equal quality costs $500-$600. This one is a fraction of the price. I am a fat ass dude. I am over 350 lbs. I sat on it (in cart form) and had my GF push me around to test it out. She was able to move me all over the house with ease. The cart did not bend, buckle, or break. Actually I don't even remember it flexing. It felt rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ruimerman

customer_reviews.title: Broken before arrival
customer_reviews.text: This is was broken on arrival. I bought this specifically for a move. I did not read carefully to notice it needed to be assembled (however some buyers said it was fully assemble). When it arrived it was in pieces & I had already packed all my tools. I ended not even using it and just packed it up for my move. Now I go to put it together and notice that the plastic peices are actually broken in several places. It is of course beyond the return period so I’m out the money. INSPECT THIS CAREFULLY if you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Soles

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE FALSLY ADVERTISED!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The advertisement says 700 lb capacity. The assembly instructions say 600 lb capacity. The sticker on the unit itself says 300 lb capacity. The instructions contain inconsistencies with itself. They describe using 8 washers total, but all they send is 6 and the parts list only lists 6. I'm excited to hurt myself and destroy whatever I'm carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even come with all the parts!
customer_reviews.text: Received the box with the unassembled parts for this hand truck today, and while it looks like a good unit, it was missing the fasteners required to complete assembly, so I had to go to ACE hardware to find the parts to complete assembly. I thought about returning it, but need the hand truck for work, so can't wait for a return. LAZY manufacturer not ensuring all the parts are included in the bloody box!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Purvis Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not easily assembled...
customer_reviews.text: Avoid at all costs. When you assembly..pray all parts are there and hope the tires are not flat from being defective. The parts do not assemble easily. This is why we have tariffs! The box says made in America with and American flag. The parts box says made in China. I guess the box was made in America?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hass

customer_reviews.title: Great cart!
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for me! It was easy to put together and take apart. As you can see, I loaded it up and it maneuvered good.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: LIGHT, WELL DESIGNED, AND EASY TO PUT TOGETHER IF RIGH TOOLS USED.
customer_reviews.text: MY ONLY COMPLAINT ABOUT THIS PRODUCT, ARE THE CARTER PINS. THEY SHOULD BE A HALF INCH LONGER SO WHEN BENT DOWN AFTER INSERTION THEY WOULD HAVE ENOUGH BEND BACK SO THEY WILL NOT FALL OUT. I CAN TELL WITH THESE PINS, SINCE THEY HAVE LITTLE LENGTH TO BEND THEY WILL PROBABLY FALL OUT IN TIME. I WILL LOOK AHEAD FOR NEW PINS. *CORRECTION TO REVIEW* THE CART IS MOSTLY PLASTIC THAT APPARENTLY IS NOT FULLY CURED BEFORE SHIPPING. STRONG CHEMICAL SMELL SO LEAVE OUTSIDE FOR 3 OR 4 DAYS BEFORE BRINGING IN.
customer_reviews.author: burning cook

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Choice- Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: It costs a little more than some, but the ability to convert it into a cart is priceless. And don’t underestimate the inflatable tires instead of the cheaper hard wheels! It sails over little bumps that would stop hard wheels dead, and you don’t even feel them. You can also adjust the inflation to suit your terrain. These add-ons do make it a little heavier than the cheaper ones, but... it rolls. The amount of effort this cart will save you will by far eclipse the effort of rarely having to lift it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Dosch

customer_reviews.title: Good item, US made. Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good hand truck and appears that it will last a good while for the hauling of music equipment and speakers. I like that the frame is polymer- it keeps the truck light and strong. The rubber wheels have decent bearings and roll smoothly. Customer service from Harper was great. I especially liked not having to buy an item made in commie China. Cons: The packaging is designed for pallet shipping, not for individual shipping. The provided instructions were lacking. Assembly wasn't difficult though. 14 mm or 9/16 std socket will be used 4 times. To Harper- I suggest that the packaging be redesigned to accommodate individual shipping/handling so that items don't break during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Lewinsky

customer_reviews.title: Very well built, a real bargain.
customer_reviews.text: I owned one one of these for about 20 years, using it mostly to move heavy things to and from our boat on the docks. Since the frame is a reinforced plastic the frame is light, tough, and will not rust. I replaced all the nuts and bolts provided with stainless hardware, for $5 or so. I painted the mild steel axle and the handle with marine primer and marine enamel to stave off corrosion. On the old one, at about 12 years I replaced the wheels and pneumatic tires just due to sun and old age. The original one is still hauling things around for someone who was certainly they needed it more than me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HOW DO YOU PUT IT TOGETHER WITHOUT ANY HARDWARE
customer_reviews.text: Received the dolly quickly. The box looked like someone had opened it and probably returned it. Pulled everything out of the box.....no hardware. Doesn't work very well if you can't put it together.
customer_reviews.author: J. DUGGAN

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy..
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. This will be a life saver when I have to move next month. I was very nervous when I saw the frame was plastic, but after i assembled it, it seems to be very sturdy and strong. I am 200 lbs and sat on it, and the frame did no budge or bend. I should have no issues moving around boxes and suitcases. I highly recommend this to anyone who may have to use it every once in a while. I dont this will hold up to regular use, but I could be wrong. I will post another update after I load test it during the move. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Sonnet L. Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Ok But You Need Good Tools To Assemble It
customer_reviews.text: When it reads, “lightweight” it is because the main body is made of plastic. That was disappointing but acceptable to make it easy to transport but what bothered me is they didn’t give the customer a simple tool to tighten the nuts on the base plate. I have a simple Stanley tool kit and all of the ratchet wrench parts are too small. So I’m forced to use pliers, which hurts my hands as I’m older. I guess the company expects everyone who orders this to have the proper tools. I wish it was shipped already assembled. Now I’ll likely lose the nuts when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good once you put it together
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took a while. Instructions were not entirely clear at first, so that took some time. And it was really difficult to get the little wheels into place - they just would not go down into the holes on the frame of the dolly. But once assembled, the dolly was great! I used it to get some very heavy boxes from the front of my house around to the basement in the back, including down some stairs. The dolly is sturdy but lightweight, and fairly easily maneuvers in difficult situations. It converts easily from upright to wagon-style.
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: The assembly experience was great. It was well packaged and has good instructions. The tires arrived inflated. They even improved the experience from their original design by using carriage bolts. I only used it a few times since, but it seems sturdy and the pneumatic tires are really nice. My only criticisms would be 1) the lift plate could be a little longer, but I'll get by fine with the length it is, and 2) petty, but it took me a moment to find the axle (which was taped to the side of the frame).
customer_reviews.author: 1PoorDude

customer_reviews.title: A+ For Home and Office Use
customer_reviews.text: I needed to move some office furniture out of an apartment and move some bedroom furniture in. This hand truck was like having a second person. Office cabinets were heavy and had two sections. Used it as a hand truck to get under the cabinets, tilted it back and then used the cart configuration to roll it out. Moved a queen size mattress by using the handle with the bend up to support one end of the mattress. A little balance was all that was needed. Perfect for home and light office/business use. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great full-size, convertible, hand truck
customer_reviews.text: Modest weight is really nice for this convertible hand truck, as are the stair-friendly runners. Besides a great vertical and horizontal hand truck, I could move a heavy load down stairs safely by a sliding, then rolling, action. Although not a 3-wheel stair climbing hand truck, the overall versatility for the price means I do not need multiple hand trucks for the 3 different occasional uses. It is also very easy to convert, with multiple handle depths for moving taller vertical loads.
customer_reviews.author: jph

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a pretty nice hand truck but do be aware there is assembly involved. Not a tremendous amount but enough to where I open the box and let out an audible sigh. The instructions were not overly helpful but “luckily” I’ve assembled way too many things in my life and could figure this out fairly quickly. It does feel fairly sturdy and maneuverable. The handle does have some wiggle To it when using so it could be a tighter fit but overall will definitely get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Ellis

customer_reviews.title: good product, false advertising
customer_reviews.text: Great light weight hand truck for home use, but it boggles my mind how rediculously false the advertising is. It is not able to handle anywhere close to 700lbs, or even 500. If you are putting more than 300 in the two wheel setup you are asking for trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Spawne32

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: So well made-I use it for my art shows carting everything around and let me tell you this thing is amazing. I knew I wanted sturdy large wheels as I am sometimes on grassy or bumpy areas and this thing handles it like a champ. MY only want from this is a break of some sort, rolls so smoothly if there is a slight slant when it is empty it will roll a bit. But well made, strong, and makes my life so much easier, just wish I had gotten it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: MoxxiFoxxy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cart to facilitate a 0.3 mile move across a condo development to my new unit. It has come in handy. I upgraded the hard casters with pnuematic tires only because I was concerned about neighbors hating the sound of a hand cart loaded with hundreds of pounds cruising down asphalt in front of brick buildings at 6am. It is highly maneuverable and the few times I couldnt use a freight elevator I was able to drift it into a passenger elevator no problem. It has handled the open road easily and feels sturdy without being as heavy as a metal frame would be.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great cart and dolly!
customer_reviews.text: This is the dolly/cart to buy. Extremely versatile turning from upright dolly to a cart in seconds. Helped me move a refrigerator on my own out of a basement up steps with no problem. I would recommend to a friend. I would absolutely go with this upgraded version not the 500 pound one offered by Harper. mid century modern
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: I question 700 lbs use. This might be able to move few things around but they do break easily. Too many plastic parts. Plus, pin gets lost a lot. I bought 7 for my delivery trucks and only few are still working. I found in Costco aluminum one for $95, already assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Dominik

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade to the previous model I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Manual wasn’t too great but was easy to put together. There are two slots for the wheels which I don’t know why. Based on the picture/instructions in the manual the first slot caused the wheels to rub against the boxes. After moving the wheels to the second holds, issues resolved. The bigger pneumatic wheels work much better over rough surfaces. Works great as cart or hand truck. I give it a 4 because the stair slider is ok as long as you don’t use with hardwood stairs. It will leave a mark.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Well made but one Rim damaged
customer_reviews.text: Cart was easy to put together and looked well made however I checked the wheels today and one of them the inside of the rim where the tire seals to it has a major chip in it, I don't think it will affect the maneuverability and use of the item but I think the manufacturer should replace it, as far as the tires being inflated to the proper levels mine were not they only had five pounds of air and their rated with 30lb, I filled mine to 25. We make a move tomorrow with it we'll see how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, moves a good amount without much effort.
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent hand truck to move stuff you wouldn't be able to lift on your own around the house. The little brass piece on the smaller wheel arrived snapped so that was a little bit of an issue. I had to get some pliers to clamp it down so I could get the wheel in. Hoping that doesn't cause an issue down the road. The instructions could be a little better but if I was able to get it set up, I imagine everyone else could as well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use to move gun safe
customer_reviews.text: Used this dolly to move a 550 lb gun safe. Specs say 600 lb limit on two wheels and 700 lb limit on 4 wheels. We used 4 wheels just in case and the smaller (plastic) wheels broke. The metal pistons that hold those wheels also bent. Since those wheels broke, then we had to move the safe on only the two bigger wheels...one of this wheels deflated. So the weight limit is not what it claims to be.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: The best Dolly I've ever used!!
customer_reviews.text: I tend to have a great deal of heavy stuff to move around my home and this dolly comes in handy all the time.I've purchased others via amazon and they just weren't sturdy enough and it didn't make me feel secure to move my items.A definite must buy and the bigger tires make it easy going up and down stairs as well.
customer_reviews.author: TheIncredibleMan

customer_reviews.title: Great hand truck
customer_reviews.text: These hand trucks are excellent! I took a chance on them being nylon instead of metal but I'm glad I got them. They are light weight but strong. The metal plate is pretty thick and is solid. The set also has an extendable tube metal handle that would be handy to have in some situations. I also elected to get the pneumatic tires because they usually give a smoother ride. Overall I'm very pleased with these and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: V.Bell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for moving!
customer_reviews.text: I move all the time and most times don’t have many people to help out. I purchased this to make my life easier and it definitely did that! My husband was able to move most of our stuff by himself in a shorter period of time thanks to this dolly. It is lightweight but sturdy and able to carry a lot! Very easy to put together. Everyone should own one. Wayyy better than renting one. So happy I finally decided to buy one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: DrCMackey

customer_reviews.title: Plastic frame is brittle, locking tabs break easily
customer_reviews.text: Thin box for heavy item, was busted open. Casters and nuts and bolts were missing. After some confusion, Harper sent me replacements. Resumed putting it together, only to find that the cheesy plastic frame had broken. The little tabs that hold it together had been busted along the way somewhere. The plastic is just too brittle and flimsy for the job. The tabs themselves are a weak point. This item would be frightening if loaded to capacity.
customer_reviews.author: ironandglass

customer_reviews.title: Decent cart, but plan on replacing tires
customer_reviews.text: I read questions and it said "solid rubber tires" - yes, they are solid, and we made sure there was proper tire pressure before using, but as soon as we put a stove on it, both tires went flat half-way to the truck. Cannot pump them back up, had to replace tires at $20 per tire - so to me, not a good value despite what everyone else says.
customer_reviews.author: Melody's Emporium

customer_reviews.title: Oh, so very useful!  Comfirm parts are all there before assembling.
customer_reviews.text: Getting ready for a move, I love the options this offers as a hand truck or dolly. Pneumatic Wheels are awesome; I wouldn't bother going for a lower capacity all plastic wheel version. The few extra dollars are worth the extra flexibility on imperfect surfaces. My ONLY knock was the item arrived a few parts shy of complete... All 4 cotterpins were missing when we were assembling the wheel assembly. So CHECK your parts before you try to assemble for less irritation/ delay (we just ran to the hardware store).
customer_reviews.author: Momtobe

customer_reviews.title: perfect dolly/handcart
customer_reviews.text: this is a great dolly/handcart. its lightweight so you can pick it up around the house/garage or load it in your car with no problem. the fact that it can turn into a dolly or a handcart by changing just two pins and the handlebar makes this very versatile. purchased this for my business which requires moving a lot of boxes and its made everything a lot easier for me. i definitely recommend this to anyone who needs a dolly and/or handcart.
customer_reviews.author: Ian A.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with several areas of the main body broken although the box was in perfect condition. The body and sides are individually molded pieces which "snap" together. That's great if you want to save money on larger shipping containers, however, the result is a product that does not hold up to the shipping itself.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Lackey

customer_reviews.title: Easy Asssembly...Small hammer helpful for small wheel seating
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Leave bolts finger tight. Bend carter keys just enough to retain. When assembled without yellow handle, tighten bolts with 2 9/16" wrenches and bend the carter keys. Might also be good to devise a steel pin captive method to protect against loss. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine - just feels flimsy in a way
customer_reviews.text: Is working well for us - so in this, it meets our needs. Not sure I would buy it again though. Yes, it is very strong and capable for what it is made of. However, this strength is designed around actually carrying the weight vs. maneuvering the weight about. What I am getting at is once you have a load on this truck, it is fine. We notice plenty of unwanted flexing which gives the truck a bit of a flimsy feel. Not yet concerned that it can not perform as rated but I certainly prefer a bit more of a 'solid' feel when I am moving any weight that requires a hand truck.
customer_reviews.author: jahTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful
customer_reviews.text: The bottom plate is very small and narrow. Totally useless. Its only like 7 in wide. No brakes on tires so it’s very difficult to load with out someone holding it.
customer_reviews.author: CARLO

customer_reviews.title: Great multi use dolly
customer_reviews.text: All the nuts and bolts were accurately included for this. Definitely good quality, and will hold up with use and heavy weight. Only complaint is the wheel is slightly swayed after installation, even after i followed the instructions. Im sure it was a user error, but figured I would mention it. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Moses Solis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hand Truck for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal for a hand truck at this price point, especially shipped free. A metal one would be better, but also cost twice as much, especially if ordered online. Fairly easy to build, and it's a standard size. It can fit a very large box perfectly, and will fit one large box on its bottom plus one large box on its side (20x20x15 box) - so 35" usable length.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool for heavy objects, easy to change from upright to wagon style in seconds.
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight dolly is fantastic. I haul (woman) many heavy items, this makes it so easy. The unit is lightweight the large wheels make pulling or pushing easier over rough terrain. The quick switch is AMAZING from wagon style to traditional dolly. I wish I had this tool years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Truck
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a house move, and it performed very well. Assembled with no problem in 10 minutes with easy to follow instructions. Handle is adjustable for length if increased radius fulcrum is required, and easily converts to a flatbed cart. Lightweight - Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CrisJ

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: Love this--the sturdy look of it. Haven't yet put it to much use. Moved large flower pots. NOT an easy install, had to get help from a handy man. Though if you are handy, it'd probably be OK for you.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Pacific NW

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy and lightweight unit. Easy to switch between vertical and horizontal modes. Also great customer service from Harper. I bought mine from Amazon Warehouse Deals and it was missing parts. Rather than return it to Amazon, I emailed Harper directly and replacements came within 3 days!
customer_reviews.author: Kaleb Van Gerpen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I moved a full size washer and dryer by myself from a 3rd floor condo into a cargo van and then onto the basement of my new place. I’m 1.69m tall and don’t go to the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Favela Tentori

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cart
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cart, looks pretty stylish too if youre storing in view (i.e. live in an apartment or something without a garage or secondary locker.) The rubber on the wheels is not too obnoxious too. Was fairly easy to assemble and works great. Nice price for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J.

customer_reviews.title: Better than you might think
customer_reviews.text: Used this to move offices. Worked well as a cart and as a handtruck. The large caster wheels easily rolled over wide cracks and thresholds. Very lightweight to carry upstairs. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and utility of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: CSC

customer_reviews.title: Easily assembled in less than 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with the product; as advertised. Assembly was easy with a small crescent wrench and completed in less than 20 minutes (including time to print out a picture of a fully assembled unit - which would be helpful to have with instructions to complement the small instruction pictures).
customer_reviews.author: My2Sense

customer_reviews.title: Lip is too small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to move a 67 lb. printer down some stairs. The printer depth is twice as big as the lip on the truck. It does not support but 1/2 of the printer. Will not work. It was easy to put together and lightweight but it is really made to be a truck rather than a dolly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile.
customer_reviews.text: I tiled My New home's floor. Before the tile went down My New Kitchen cabinets arrived. I had to be able to efficiently move these Cabinets several times. I helped unload them from the truck and knew that they were heavy.So I chose to purchase this Hand Truck. I am glad I did and would say that every Home should have one !!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Got us through a move for less than the cost of renting, and we still have the hand truck!
customer_reviews.text: We were going to rent a hand truck from the company we rented a truck from. However, this option was about the same cost as renting, so I took a chance. I am very glad I did! It has been used many times since the move. Definitively recommend it! A word of caution, though: It is part plastic, and you will not be able to carry the same loads as an all metal hand truck. If you don't have to move 500lb loads, you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic part broken before I even attempted to put it together. Design flaw. I very highly don’t it could carry 200 pounds let alone the 700 that it’s rated to carry. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: shawn salva

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive general purpose handtruck
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it for one challenging task, moving a tall mahogany china cabinet up one floor. It worked well even though it is not designed as a true stair climber. Wheels are large enough to make climbing stairs with a ~200 lb cabinet quite reasonable. Four wheel design allowed cabinet to be laid flat to pass through doorways. I found assembly quick and easy. I would not describe truck as really lightweight as it is only a few lbs lighter than metal equivalent, but don't consider the weight to be a relevant issue. Definitely prefer pneumatic wheels to smaller hand truck I have with solid plastic wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Rob O

customer_reviews.title: Used once -- bolts & lug nuts fall off!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this dolly cart has such high reviews. Our bolts and lug nuts always fall off -- nearly impossible to tighten enough to keep them on. Wobble horribly. Maybe I got a dud, but this won't even get us through our move. Simply would not recommend. Go with a classic no frills dolly instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mrsktea

customer_reviews.title: Hauling ability is prettu sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I ordered it to haul boxes. The plastic material is pretty sturdy and will haul a lot of weight. When converting to a cart, the bar is a little less sturdy to pull the weight but still got the job done. For a light-weight item I believe you will be satisfied with the value of the product and it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Better designed.
customer_reviews.text: Why i dislike product no stabilization bar at bottom back of equipment. Need to include more washers for wheel stabilization to wobbly. Got to finish modifying for safety and stabilization.No rubber piece for hand comfort on top.It will do after modifications.
customer_reviews.author: global

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and well-designed for utility. A little less rigid than I thought it would be. Also, it is not as wide as I hoped. These characteristics make it a little unstable for big items like refrigerators. But, I moved a full size fridge up and down some steps with no real problems. So, I think it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Did not expect much, pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with the product. For 80 bucks, I did not think this thing would be that great, especially since it is made of plastic. I am actually pretty impressed with the product. Claims to hold up to 700 pounds, not sure if we moved anything that heavy, but definitely held up with several full filing cabinets, probably about 400 pounds each. Used the dolly throughout moving a business, still acts and functions as new. Will definitely purchase another one for day to day use in a warehouse facility. Do not be afraid of the plastic. Its is extremely sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Even Though It Has That One Issue Others Have Pointed Out...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I havent tried for 700-lbs and dont intend to but it handles 300-lbs just fine. Tires are excellent, and it moves quietly wherever you go. My only one gripe is when you move the tires forward for use on stairs. They will rub against a large box but i knew that when i bought it (from other reviews) so it was no surprise.
customer_reviews.author: not4nuthin

customer_reviews.title: Needs a bigger platform...
customer_reviews.text: I like this OK, but the wide plastic frame is a pain to hook bungee cords or even some tie-downs to - and since the platform is painfully narrow, everything needs to be strapped down! Wish I'd looked a little more at that than just tires and price!
customer_reviews.author: V. James

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. It is strong and easy to operate. I use it to pull air conditioner into a shipping container which I use for storage without a ramp. you can easily pull things into that container or push it out of the container without the ramp. This is a distance of about 18 to 20 inches. It travels easily over unpaved ground. I have it for a few months now and I use it daily for my business. I took the time to write this review so that I could help others.
customer_reviews.author: LENOX E LOOBY

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to maneuver, easy to lift and holds a considerable amount of weight. Only drawback is opening is pretty large, have to put something in-between smaller boxes and the upright. Other than this issue, it's a great product
customer_reviews.author: KenG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I found the assembly very easy and only took about 15 minutes on my own going slow. After assembly I noticed how sturdy it is and loved the ease it took to move 50 bags of rocks. It surely saved years on my back.
customer_reviews.author: LiberalsAreInsane

customer_reviews.title: Quality product at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This hand truck is lightweight but durable. The large tires remove some of the shock of going over rough surfaces or down a step. It maneuvers easily. I have only used it in the upright position but it has easily handled the moving of boxes from one place to another.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.D

customer_reviews.title: Broken in three places on arrival...
customer_reviews.text: First off, this is plastic. I don't know how it could possibly be rated for 700lbs. It is so fragile that just by the wheels not being secured inside the box during shipping, they broke three of the six clips that hold the support braces in place. (See pics) If you aren't in a hurry (I was) and you don't have really heavy items like a refrigerator, this might work for you but I wouldn't risk it. Beyond this, I can't vouch for it's performance as it was unusable when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You may have to sand a little.
customer_reviews.text: I must warn you that you may have to sand the plastic part of this item to assemble it but that was a minor effort for such a high-quality , light weight hand truck.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Came on time and easy to assemble if your mechanically inclined
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and easy to assemble if your mechanically inclined. Granted the instructions are not that great. The odor that some are complaining about is from the tire compound so store it in your garage or shed if you're sensitive. I had no problem putting it together and like it's features. I'll have to check the pneumatic air tire pressure before putting a load on it. Nowhere in the instructructions do they mention recommended tire pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle1

customer_reviews.title: Clutch for moving to an APT. or any move for that matter!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this for my recent apartment move. It was lightweight and had great maneuverability! It quickly changes from one inclination to the next with removable pins and the handle. The big wheels are nice for going over bumps and cracks. Cut down moving time by 10x. Must have for a move if doing it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Coombs

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful.
customer_reviews.text: Solid device that works well. My goal for buying this hand truck was infrequent use to lug my window A/C units each season. Since then I have found other uses such as moving furniture when we paint rooms. and moving garden stuff that comes from Home Depot. Small advisory: the tires have a tendency to out-gas a petro-chemical smell. not a show-stopper but my wife doesn't much like it.
customer_reviews.author: Foofoodust

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Required + Tools Needed
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, but (per the Headline): Assembly is Required and Tools Needed. A rubber hammer (or similar) to knock the front two wheels in place and a combo or socket wrench. Also it would have been nice for an adjustable "hand" vs. "pins" to change the configuration, but still great value for the money as well as quality!
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: Dolly worked great moving into my new house, I was looking at renting one from uhaul and found this one that was not much more then the cost of the rental, glad I bought it instead. Moved my big fridge with ease, the handle hight is adjustable which was a great advantage,I would recommend this to anyone needing a dolly.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Versatile product
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased that I could put this together in just a few minutes. The handle that allows it to be converted from an upright dolly to a furniture mover is very well designed and easy to change without having to reverse engineer the assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Webster

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Hand Truck!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this extensively during a move, and I'm impressed with everything about this product. It's sturdy, light in weight, very configurable, and easy to assemble. I could not have moved without it - two-person jobs were easy for me alone. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: FPG

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I hauled tools and cabinets up to a third story condo for work. It moves washers and dryers just fine as well. The cart feature is nice to have. When loaded it flexes quite a bit. I plan on adding a support in the back to help keep it more ridgid for heavy loads, such as 350 pounds of bricks. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Schlabadab

customer_reviews.title: A good option if you have bulky items to move.
customer_reviews.text: Great product that saved me a lot of hassle when moving. Was mostly easy to put together, except for the lynchpins that were pretty hard to attach. Feels very sturdy, because of that it’s not super lightweight. I would say that it is lightweight when you consider how much weight it can hold. Pretty maneuverable, was able to navigate narrow hallways and pull stuff up stairs. Solid product very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This hand truck has worked as described and more than met my expectations. Assembly is straight forward and took about 15-20 minutes with common hand tools. I used it to move cabinets around my house including up steps into my garage - it was stable and solid with all but the tallest of cabinets. My only complaint would be with the pneumatic tires - they lose air and need to be pumped occasionally after sitting unused for longer periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Jaskot

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy. Don't chance it.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy plastic. Easy to twist. 700lbs is very very questionable. Might be lucky with 200. Vote of no confidence. Sent back before even putting together. Buy an all metal.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Stroup

customer_reviews.title: Back at it
customer_reviews.text: It's Christmas morning. My husband was not just happy to get something like this, he couldn't wait to put it together and use it!! He came back inside, giddy as a school boy! According to him, it's the best thing he's ever gotten!!
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: I am really frustrated with this product- we bought this anticipating a move - we moved part of our stuff this weekend and it literally fell apart the wheel won’t stay on the rim and then the bolts fell out during transportation. We didn’t even get to use it one time. I am curious if we got a defective one or if this is standard—-
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good but can be better.
customer_reviews.text: Good but can be better. Every time you change the cart setting from a hand truck to a flatbed you need to use the 2 pins provided. If you lose any of the pins can't use the cart. If the manufacturing change this detail it will turn this model into a better one.
customer_reviews.author: K LO QUE

customer_reviews.title: Happy and Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am happy with this. While it is not heavy duty, I did move 3 refrigerators with it (one over 300#) and never felt like it was going to break. Very surprised and happy with it being a plastic dolly and all.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Limited use hand truck
customer_reviews.text: Will not hold air in the tires for a week. Very disappointing for a $80 hand truck. Of course too late to return and no service number available. Very thin rubber tires, no inner tube. Had to install $45 flat free tires. Dissapointing... 😩
customer_reviews.author: SilverSurfer

customer_reviews.title: Broken wheel and plastic
customer_reviews.text: Hoping to get some credit back at least for the useless broken wheel.. I was excited to get this based on the review but I did not expect to be the lucky winner to get a broken one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Strong and Light weight.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for transporting DI resin cylinder tanks. The tanks we move throughout the day are about 5’ tall, 12-14” in diameter and weigh about 75-100 lbs. The design and wheel base make it very agile and easily maneuverable. The tires are hardy with deep treads. The Black and Yellow looks so clean, sleek and professional on our job locations. Now it’s almost like having DI tanks that float!
customer_reviews.author: Iloveyour window homes

customer_reviews.title: Would have been perfect if it had arrived intact.
customer_reviews.text: The sockets to insert the metal hooks to lock in the handle are surrounded by plastic clips, which serve as the locking mechanism--mine arrived missing one of these clips entirely meaning only one side could have a hook inserted. This led to numerous instances of dropped items from the dolly and overall made what should have been only a mildly difficult move into a moderately frustrating one. Can't give an honest opinion on it otherwise besides saying I THINK it would have been great without that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Gilbraith

customer_reviews.title: Great Dolly, awful tires!
customer_reviews.text: All in all it's good! The tires that they give you are awful! Both of the tires went out the first time I use them. I ended up going to Harbor Freight and bought new tires for it and I haven't had any issues since. I'd rather pay a little bit more money for a cart with better tires because I think that's probably the main complain about it
customer_reviews.author: Leila E

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the overall product
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the overall product. Works just fine. Be careful when assembling. You have to be careful when putting the wheels on and tighten both sides simultaneously or else the frame will constrict and the wheel shaft will appear to be too short for the truck. Other than that it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: MDownes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Only one problem, Had 2 flat tires and they cost me as much as the device itself. It is easy to use and handles anything well. Just has flat tie issues.
customer_reviews.author: KathynKansas

customer_reviews.title: Hand Cart Amazing
customer_reviews.text: When we got this is was easy to assemble. Very lightweight we put it to the test by removing an old couch. We can say it was the best investment for our home.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Yardi

customer_reviews.title: Pneumatic tires great
customer_reviews.text: The tires are great for moving the hand truck and not getting bogged down in gravel. It should be strong with the frame and has many uses, I stacked wood on it when I was out of power for days. I did have to run a rope to hold large items on while transporting them. I think it is the best hand truck I could get.
customer_reviews.author: J. Napora

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Hello, we received the dolly. The box was in pretty rough shape dent cuts and holes in the cardboard box. The dolly, axle and wheels were in box. However, none of the assembly hardware such as nuts bolts ect were in the box. I’m not sure if they escaped out the box holes or if they never made it in box. I do know I’d like to receive them so I can put this together ASAP otherwise I may as well return it as it is unusable without it. Please send thx
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I was driving for Goshare which is like uber for people who need something moved. Turns out everyone needs one of these in their house no matter what. I've used it so many times and the ability to make it a cart is great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: cheap nuts and bolts
customer_reviews.text: I only used it 3 times to load camera equipment , and the nut holding the front wheel on stripped , so i know eventually all of them is going to strip, so I recommend going to a local hardware store to purchase more stable nuts and bolts 🔩,
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester Sessoms

customer_reviews.title: Moving day
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile. Can be used as a hand truck or a cart. Big soft rubber wheels won't damage the floor. I have wooden floors so I need to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Wing

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Strong but Lite
customer_reviews.text: This dolly I like because its way lite weight verses the metal ones but still strong. We do books so we can do 6-7 cases on the dolly at one time stacked on top of each other and they each weigh about 35lbs so that's a total of 245lbs and absolutely no problem with that kind of weight. And the other nice thing is you can flip the handle and have a rolling dolly as well without carrying the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Tris

customer_reviews.title: Be aware
customer_reviews.text: Broke on the first use. Its mostly plastic. It holds up but not foe anything heavy like an empty gun safe. Would only recommend using it for boxes or lighter items
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, lightweight, does the job. I bought it to move music equipment and use it to move everything including my 400+ pound wood stove. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larimer

customer_reviews.title: Best Hand Truck I have ever used!!
customer_reviews.text: This handy little tool has save my back countless hours of aching and help me to get the job done on time. Made in Wichita Kansas right here in the heart of the USA! Super lightweight and super durable, you need a dolly or handcart, go with Harper!!
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Hand Truck
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a great hand truck this is it!
customer_reviews.author: DavidS

product_meta.title: Harper Trucks 700 lb Capacity Glass Filled Nylon Convertible Hand Truck and Dolly with 10" Pneumatic Wheels
product_meta.description:
Style:Style is 10" Pneumatic Wheels| Pattern Name:Hand TruckHarper Trucks exclusive I-Beam Steel-Tough nylon truss is 30% lighter than steel and designed to be as strong as steel or aluminum hand trucks. Built-in stair glides for easy moving up or down stairs and curbs. Heavy-duty 10" pneumatic All-Terrain tires and 5" heavy-duty swivel casters for easy maneuverability. Made in USA. Frame factory assembled - Requires easy assembly of wheels and base plate. Since 1940, Harper Trucks' mission has been to sell the highest quality products in the market. We have grown from a small, regional metal fabricator to the largest hand truck manufacturer in the world. As the world's largest manufacturer of hand trucks, Harper makes one of every three such trucks sold in the United States. Harper Trucks are manufactured in a plant of 400,000 square feet with full robotic and new composite-injection capabilities.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Harper Trucks exclusive I-Beam Steel-Tough nylon truss is 30% lighter than steel and designed to be as strong as steel or aluminum hand trucks. Built-in stair glides for easy moving up or down stairs and curbs. Heavy-duty 10" pneumatic All-Terrain tires and 5" heavy-duty swivel casters for easy maneuverability. Made in USA. Frame factory assembled - Requires easy assembly of wheels and base plate. Since 1940, Harper Trucks' mission has been to sell the highest quality products in the market. We have grown from a small, regional metal fabricator to the largest hand truck manufacturer in the world. As the world's largest manufacturer of hand trucks, Harper makes one of every three such trucks sold in the United States. Harper Trucks are manufactured in a plant of 400,000 square feet with full robotic and new composite-injection capabilities. Axle is 5/8 inch
feature_bullets: Glass-Filled Nylon Plastic Frame is chemical, corrosion and rust resistant for longer life
Converts in seconds from 2 wheel dolly to 4 wheel cart - 600 lb dolly and 700 lb cart capacity (Product images illustrates both uses, but only one cart is being sold)
Three position telescoping handle, built-in stair glides for easy moving up or down stairs and curbs
Frame factory assembled, requires easy assembly of wheels, casters, axle and base plate.

Manufactured in USA; Harper exclusive I-Beam Glass Filled Nylon Plastic Frame is 30% lighter than steel and designed for maximum strength (Plastic frame is factory Pre Assembled). Heavy-duty 10" pneumatic wheels and 5" heavy-duty swivel casters

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,466 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
